flawed_nl_solution:
Book 1 was $12.50 and book 2 was $15.00 so 13 +15 = $32
He was buying 4 books, so these 2 were 25% off so 32 * 0.25 = $8
These two books came out to 32-8 = $<<32-8=24>>24
Books 3 & 4 were both $10 each so 2*10 = $20
When you add all 4 books together, 24+20 = $<<24+20=44>>44
To get free shipping he would need to spend 50-44 = $<<50-44=6>>6 more on books

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 28.0, not 32.0. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
